Definition.WordDefinition:
outright \out"right`\, adv. 1. Immediately; without delay; at once; as, he was killed outright. [1913 Webster]
2. Completely; utterly. --Cardinal Manning. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
outright \out"right`\ adj. Downright; plain; unqualified; utter; straight-out; as, an outright lie.
Syn: flat-out, out-and-out. [PJC]

outright adj : without reservation or exception [syn: {straight-out}, {unlimited}] adv 1: without restrictions or stipulations or further payments; "buy outright" 2: without reservation or concealment; "she asked him outright for a divorce" 3: without any delay; "he was killed outright" [syn: {instantaneously}, {instantly}, {in a flash}]
